m :  you should have seen the line at the housing office .  it took me an hour to make my dormitory deposit for next year .  have you made yours yet ?
w :  no  i am not sure i am going to .
m :  there is not much time left .  the deadline is may 1 st .  that ' s just two weeks from now .  are you short of cash ?
m :  you ' d better hurry up if you want a dormitory next september .  there aren ' t enough rooms for everyone .  and first - year students have priority .
w :  well  i ' ve been thinking of living off campus .
m :  have you any idea how much that will cost ?  there ' s the rent  public facilities  and you probably need a car to commute .

w :  i know it will be more expensive  but i think i can handle it  though .  this dorm is just so noisy that i can ' t get anything done .  maybe my grades would be better if i had some peace and quiet in a place of my own .
m :  you should study in the library the way i do .  think of the money you will save .
w :  i ' ve got to think it over some more .  there are still two weeks left in april .

question: in what month is the conversation taking place ?
